tum.dss.thesis

Interface LinearProgramInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GurobiModel, GurobiModelDual

    public interface LinearProgramInterface
    Interface for relaxed IP, e.g. a Gurobi Model.
    Author:
    Florian Stallmann

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void createLP()
      Creates the LP model with relaxation as default.
      void createLP(boolean relax)
      Creates the LP model either relaxed or integral.
      double getObjective()
      Retrieves objective value respectively the optimal social welfare of the LP.
      double getResult(int i, int j)
      Retrieves result allocation for player i and subset j.
      ListMultimap<Integer,Integer> getSolUsed()
      Retrieves map of indices (i,j) where xi,j > 0, so solutions that have been used.
      void setData(MechanismDataInterface data)
      Injects data to model and reset all variables for a new run.
      void solveLP()
      Solves LP model (after creation) and map results if necessary.

    • Method Detail

      • setData

        void setData(MechanismDataInterface data)
        Injects data to model and reset all variables for a new run.
        Parameters:
        data - mechanism data.

      • createLP

        void createLP()
        Creates the LP model with relaxation as default.

      • createLP

        void createLP(boolean relax)
        Creates the LP model either relaxed or integral.
        Parameters:
        relax - relaxation of integrality constraint.

      • solveLP

        void solveLP()
        Solves LP model (after creation) and map results if necessary.

        If the model hasn't been created before this method should call createLP automatically.

      • getResult

        double getResult(int i,
                 int j)
        Retrieves result allocation for player i and subset j.

        The solveLP method must be called before!

        Parameters:
        i - index of player.
        j - index of subset.
        Returns:
        LP solution for pair (i,j).

      • getObjective

        double getObjective()
        Retrieves objective value respectively the optimal social welfare of the LP.

        The solveLP method must be called before!

        Returns:
        objective value.

      • getSolUsed

        ListMultimap<Integer,Integer> getSolUsed()
        Retrieves map of indices (i,j) where xi,j > 0, so solutions that have been used.

        The solveLP method must be called before!

        Multimap will save multiple values for one key, e.g. 1->[2,3];2->[1,5,6].

        Returns:
        map of all indices of used solutions.
